messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: NAK
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/28/2007 6:47:32 P.M. Pacific Daylight Time, carenkh@earthlink.net writes: Ah,  thanks.  I am grateful I was not online as much as I am now
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/28/2007 6:47:32 P.M. Pacific Daylight Time,
carenkh@... writes:

Ah, thanks. I am grateful I was not online as much as I am now when
mine were nursing age. I felt guilty enough reading books while nursing!


Ah, I like it. It gives us "alone time" while we are together :)

Karen

messages.subject: Re: NAK
messages.msgSnippet: Ah, thanks.  I am grateful I was not online as much as I am now when mine were nursing age.  I felt guilty enough reading books while nursing! A friend has a
messages.messageBody:
Ah, thanks. I am grateful I was not online as much as I am now when
mine were nursing age. I felt guilty enough reading books while nursing!

A friend has a theory that every mother has a magnet in her butt that
is activated whenever she gets on the phone, drawing her kids ever
closer...

peace,
Caren

--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Brian & Alexandra
Polikowsky" <polykow@...> wrote:
>
> NAK Nursing At Keyboard.

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] NAK
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/28/2007 4:09:36 P.M. Pacific Daylight Time, carenkh@earthlink.net writes: I have  googled and wiki d, and can t find a definition for NAK
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/28/2007 4:09:36 P.M. Pacific Daylight Time,
carenkh@... writes:

I have googled and wiki'd, and can't find a definition for NAK that
fits how you're using it. What's it mean?

Thanks,
Caren


Nursing At Keyboard...one of the many acronyms, lol!

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] NAK
messages.msgSnippet: NAK Nursing  At Keyboard. Babies love to nure when you sit and want to write something. its like when the phone rings and kids need you at the same time. Alex
messages.messageBody:
NAK Nursing At Keyboard.
Babies love to nure when you sit and want to write something. its like when the phone rings and kids need you at the same time.
Alex
